pullRequest.body:
Define `SimpleExtension F K`, which says that `K` is a simple field extension of `F`, and show that together with transcendentality it implies `IsFractionRing F[X] K`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

- [x] depends on: #14710

### PR summary [ee7133a4bf](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14704/commits/ee7133a4bf51f8d676bba78d571b7e9b62443cb6)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.FieldTheory.SimpleExtension`|1261|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ SimpleExtension`
`+ SimpleExtension.X_eq_k`
`+ SimpleExtension.adjoin_eq_top`
`+ SimpleExtension.equivAdjoinRoot`
`+ SimpleExtension.is_adjoin`
`+ SimpleExtesion_of_finite_seperable`
`+ algebraMap_eq_aeval`
`+ finiteDimensional_iff_isAlgebraic_gen`
`+ gen_transcendental`
`+ instance (priority := 100) toAlgebra : Algebra F[X] K := (aeval se.k).toAlgebra`
`+ instance (priority := 100) toIsFractionRing [Algebra.Transcendental F K] :`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#14710~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

Having this be a typeclass with noncanonical data seems a bit strange to me. Is there a reason you choice this approach over a plain `structure` or a data-less predicate or adding an assumption `F‚üÆk‚üØ = ‚ä§` to the `IsFractionRing F[X] K` result?

> Having this be a typeclass with noncanonical data seems a bit strange to me. Is there a reason you choice this approach over a plain `structure` or a data-less predicate or adding an assumption `F‚üÆk‚üØ = ‚ä§` to the `IsFractionRing F[X] K` result?

What do you mean by "adding an assumption `F‚üÆk‚üØ = ‚ä§` to the `IsFractionRing F[X] K` result"? Without having noncanonical data I can't get an `Algebra F[X] K` instance

> What do you mean by "adding an assumption `F‚üÆk‚üØ = ‚ä§` to the `IsFractionRing F[X] K` result"?

I just mean something like
```
theorem toIsFractionRing [Algebra.Transcendental F K] (k : K) (h : F‚üÆk‚üØ = ‚ä§) :
    IsFractionRing F[X] K :=
```

I think `class IsSimpleExtension ... : Prop` is better? Your current definition is a `Type` which carries a data `k` which is the generator of `K` over `F`. The disadvantage is that different `k` gives different instance `SimpleExtension F K`, which in my opinion complicates things.

My use for this `SimpleExtension` is for Liouville's theorem, where I extend this with the existence of a `v` in `F` such that `k' / k = v'` (an exponential extension) or `k' = v' / v` (a logarithmic extension). Would there be a good way to do that with `IsSimpleExtension`?

I'm not sure. But from your code `Algebra F[X] K` seems that the generator `k` needs to be gives, otherwise this instance cannot be defined. So maybe your `SimpleExtension` with data is better...

I think you should clearly state in the docstring that `SimpleExtension` is with a generator given.
I edited the docstring, is it better now?

I think your definition means purely transcendental of transcendental degree one, right? But from your name `TranscendentalExtension` neither purely transcendental nor of transcendental degree one can be inferred, which may be misleading.
Maybe it's better to just create `Algebra.IsTranscendental` as not `Algebra.IsAlgebraic` which implies this?
I mean maybe the name could be changed to `PurelyTranscendentalOfDegOne`
I removed this typeclass and replaced this assumptions with `Algebra.Transcendental`, introduced in #14710 .
Why are these two imports needed in that file? It seems that simple extension does not use Henselian or Lie algebra.
I don't know, that's what #min_imports said, but indeed shake complains about it.
You can try to remove these two imports and see if it still compiles. (The answer is yes.)
Done.

pullRequest.title: feat(FieldTheory): define typeclass for simple extensions, and prove some properties
